author: Andrea Navarro
title: Segunda ola de calor apaga la luz y ‚Äòprende‚Äô bosques: M√©xico combate 159 incendios forestales
text: M√©xico est√° combatiendo 159 [incendios forestales](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/ciencia/2023/08/16/llegamos-a-la-edad-del-fuego-incendios-forestales-sin-control-cambiarian-el-ambiente/) activos en todo el pa√≠s en medio de la [segunda ola de calor ](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/nacional/2024/05/08/cuando-termina-la-segunda-ola-de-calor-en-mexico/)del a√±o que tambi√©n ha puesto bajo presi√≥n a la red el√©ctrica. El Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (SMN) emiti√≥ una alerta para al menos 12 estados que registrar√°n temperaturas superiores a 45 grados cent√≠grados, mientras que en el resto del pa√≠s se prev√©n temperaturas superiores a 30 grados. La ola de calor ha aumentado la demanda el√©ctrica, lo que llev√≥ al operador de la red nacional a declarar el sistema en estado de emergencia el martes, lo que significa que la potencia disponible estaba por debajo de los niveles adecuados. El sistema volvi√≥ a la normalidad menos de una hora despu√©s. Sin embargo, el mi√©rcoles, el operador [Cenace declar√≥ el sistema en estado de alerta](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/nacional/2024/05/09/apagones-en-mexico-hoy-sistema-electrico-mexicano-entra-en-estado-operativo-de-alerta-9-de-mayo/). üìå A las 11:00 horas de hoy, en‚Äî CONAFOR (@CONAFOR) [#Mexico]se reportan 159 [#IncendiosForestales]üå≥üî• activos en 25 entidades üá≤üáΩ. 3‚É£0‚É£ de los incendios üî• ocurren √°reas naturales protegidas ü¶úüêí de [#Chiapas], [#QuintanaRoo], [#Tabasco]y [#Yucat√°n]. Combaten las llamas 5,407 personas üßØüë©üöí. [pic.twitter.com/rwhe69fdCJ] [May 9, 2024] La Comisi√≥n Nacional Forestal (Conafor) dijo que los incendios forestales se extendieron a 75.474 hect√°reas. Tambi√©n dijo que 30 de los incendios ocurrieron en [ √°reas naturales protegidas](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/nacional/2023/08/17/mexico-llega-a-las-200-areas-nacionales-protegidas-semarnat-declara-13-nuevas-donde-estan/). La Ciudad de M√©xico y otras regiones del sur del pa√≠s han sufrido [apagones](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/economia/2024/05/07/estado-de-emergencia-sistema-electrico-nacional-fue-culpa-del-gobierno/), seg√∫n report√≥ El Financiero el mi√©rcoles, mientras que algunas escuelas tuvieron que cerrar o recortar sus horarios debido a las altas temperaturas en estados como San Luis Potos√≠ y Nuevo Le√≥n, inform√≥ El Universal. Algunas zonas del pa√≠s tambi√©n se han visto afectadas por la [sequ√≠a](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/cdmx/2024/05/02/sequia-en-mexico-sistema-cutzamala-cierra-abril-con-niveles-minimos-de-agua/). La metr√≥poli circundante de la capital, de unos 20 millones de habitantes, ha experimentado un suministro de agua intermitente en los √∫ltimos meses debido a unas precipitaciones inferiores a las esperadas. ¬øCu√°ndo termina la segunda ola de calor 2024? La segunda ola de calor que afecta a M√©xico desde hace una semana y que ha provocado temperaturas de hasta 51 grados, finalmente terminar√° el s√°bado 11 de mayo de 2024, de acuerdo con previsiones del Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional. El pron√≥stico extendido del SMN indica que la circulaci√≥n anticicl√≥nica en niveles medios, causante de la segunda ola de calor, se debilitar√° a partir de este s√°bado, cuando entre el [frente fr√≠o](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/tags/frente-frio/) n√∫mero 50, el cual provocar√° el descenso de las temperaturas. El SMN indic√≥ que la masa de aire del frente fr√≠o 50 propiciar√° un refrescamiento en las temperaturas en el norte y noreste del territorio nacional, adem√°s de que provocar√° lluvias, fuertes rachas de viento, posible formaci√≥n de torbellinos y/o tornados, descargas el√©ctricas y ca√≠da de granizo en Coahuila, Nuevo Le√≥n y Tamaulipas.

author: Chris Lau
title: 3 Things To Do After The S&P 500 Gained Nearly 25% In 2023
text: The S&P 500√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s ( [SPY](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/SPY)) nearly daily march higher since Oct. 30, 2023, frustrated perpetual bears. Investors who bought puts to either bet against the market or hedge its rise are at a disadvantage. Those who earned as much as 5.6% in risk-free money market funds are similarly unhappy. Yields on Schwabb√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Value Advantage Money Fund ( [SNAXX](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/SNAXX)) fell to 5.27%, decreasing its attractiveness. Markets latched onto The Federal Reserve√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s rate policy inaction. When the central bank planned another 25 basis point interest rate hike in the summer, interest-sensitive assets fell sharply. In the two previous Fed meetings, the Fed√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s rate pause unleashed what looks like a market melt-up. The index added 4.87% in the last month alone and is up 24.75% year-to-date. What are three things that investors should do after the S&P 500 defied bears expecting a √¢‚Ç¨≈ìmassive√¢‚Ç¨ÔøΩ crash? Index investors also should note that Nasdaq ( [QQQ](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/QQQ)) returned 54.77% year-to-date, matching a performance not seen since 2003. 1. Look at the Top Performers Among the individual holdings, readers should differentiate trades from investments. Trades are speculations that are generally held for the short term. Stock pickers might want to lock in profits on stocks that returned 100% or more. The trade is not yet a profit until sold. In the magnificent seven section, the large market capitalization of security alone does not justify its immunity to a sell-off. Though valuations are unfavorable, fundamentals for Nvidia ( [NVDA](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/NVDA)) are rising. On its conference call, Nvidia [said that](https://seekingalpha.com/article/4653575-nvidia-corporation-nvda-q3-2024-earnings-call-transcript) companies like Meta Platforms ( [META](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/META)) are in full production with deep learning, recommender systems, and generative AI. Cloud service providers accounted for nearly the other half of Nvidia√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Data Center revenue. Looking ahead, its H100 Tensor Core GPU instances enjoy high demand amid its general availability. In the table below [compiled from Stock Rover](https://www.stockrover.com/plans/free/?sa_author=diy_value_investing), NVDA stock more than doubled this year. META stock is close to a double return. | | Rank | | Ticker | | Company | | YTD Return | | Contribution | | No. 1 | | ( | | NVIDIA | | 238.60% | | 10.66% | | No. 2 | | ( | | Meta Platforms | | 198.30% | | 6.55% | | No. 3 | | ( | | Royal Caribbean Gr | | 162.30% | | 0.23% | | No. 4 | | ( | | Carnival | | 132.10% | | 0.13% | | No. 5 | | ( | | PulteGroup | | 130.40% | | 0.16% | | No. 6 | | ( | | Advanced Micro Devices | | 126.90% | | 1.65% | | No. 7 | | ( | | Tesla | | 111.80% | | 4.72% | | No. 8 | | ( | | Palo Alto Networks | | 111.90% | | 0.59% | | No. 9 | | ( | | Salesforce | | 101.10% | | 1.61% | | No. 10 | | ( | | Broadcom | | 105.60% | | 2.88% | | No. 11 | | ( | | General Electric | | 96.40% | | 0.84% | | No. 12 | | ( | | Fair Isaac | | 95.10% | | 0.18% | | No. 13 | | ( | | Arista Networks | | 95.20% | | 0.36% | | No. 14 | | ( | | Intel | | 95.30% | | 1.24% | | No. 15 | | ( | | Lam Research | | 91.40% | | 0.62% Above: contribution to the index discussed below. Export control regulations imposed by the U.S. government on sales to China are Nvidia√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s only headwind. Even after warning that √¢‚Ç¨≈ìsales to these destinations will decline significantly in the fourth quarter,√¢‚Ç¨ÔøΩ the stock bounced back from $450 to around $495.00. NVDA stock scores well on all factors except for valuation: In the tourism sector, Royal Caribbean ( [RCL](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/RCL)) and Carnival ( [CCL](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/CCL)) are the best post-pandemic trades for 2023. Hilton ( [HLT](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/HLT)) gets an honorable mention, especially when it scores well on growth and profitability. Investors are ignoring the high levels of debt on Royal Caribbean and Carnival√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s balance sheet. The former said that it used its cash flow from operations to cut its [debt by $775 million](https://seekingalpha.com/article/4643919-royal-caribbean-cruises-ltd-rcl-q3-2023-earnings-call-transcript). Royal Caribbean expects to pay off more than $3.5 billion in debt, cutting its leverage to the mid four times by the end of the year. Circling back to the top tech performers, readers would not find Arista ( [ANET](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/ANET)), Salesforce ( [CRM](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/CRM)), Broadcom ( [AVGO](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/AVGO)), and AMD on the list as a surprise. Conversely, Intel√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s 95.3% return is unusual. Despite HP Inc. ( [HPQ](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/HPQ)) and Dell ( [DELL](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/DELL)) warning of weak PC sales, Intel still rewarded value investors. The firm refreshed its PC CPUs to the 14th generation Meteor Lake line-up. The chips consume more power and run at higher temperatures. In addition, they cost more than the processors offered in the last two generations. Intel benefits from Israel granting $3.2 billion for the [new $25 billion chip facility](https://seekingalpha.com/news/4050249-intel-to-get-32b-grant-from-israel-for-new-25b-chip-facility). Shareholders are betting that Intel√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s artificial [intelligence on Dec. 15, 2023](https://seekingalpha.com/news/4046849-intels-ai-event-showed-focus-on-building-out-ecosystem-morgan-stanley), will compete effectively against AMD and Nvidia. 2. Look at the Worst Performers During the tax-loss season in the last several weeks, investors may have sold solar energy firms like Enphase Energy ( [ENPH](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/ENPH)) and SolarEdge ( [SEDG](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/SEDG)). After recognizing the fading tailwind from COVID vaccines, Moderna ( [MRNA](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/MRNA)) and Pfizer ( [PFE](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/PFE)) lost 43.9% and 41%, respectively. | | Rank | | Ticker | | Company | | YTD Return | | Contribution | | No. 504 | | SEDG | | SolarEdge Technologies | | -66.30% | | -0.13% | | No. 503 | | ENPH | | Enphase Energy | | -49.00% | | -0.22% | | No. 502 | | FMC | | FMC | | -47.60% | | -0.09% | | No. 501 | | DG | | Dollar Gen | | -44.30% | | -0.30% | | No. 500 | | MRNA | | Moderna | | -43.90% | | -0.32% | | No. 499 | | PFE | | Pfizer | | -41.00% | | -1.56% | | No. 498 | | EL | | Estee Lauder Cos | | -39.80% | | -0.29% | | No. 497 | | PAYC | | Paycom Software | | -33.40% | | -0.06% | | No. 496 | | ETSY | | Etsy | | -31.90% | | -0.06% | | No. 495 | | ALB | | Albemarle | | -30.40% | | -0.10% | | No. 494 | | AES | | AES | | -30.30% | | -0.08% | | No. 493 | | ILMN | | Illumina | | -29.70% | | -0.12% | | No. 492 | | HRL | | Hormel Foods | | -27.80% | | -0.05% | | No. 491 | | VFC | | VF | | -27.70% | | -0.04% | | No. 490 | | BMY | | Bristol-Myers Squibb | | -26.00% | | -0.53% | | No. 489 | | PODD | | Insulet | | -25.30% | | -0.06% | | No. 488 | | NEE | | NextEra Energy | | -25.10% | | -0.57% | | No. 487 | | SEE | | Sealed Air | | -24.10% | | -0.02% | | No. 486 | | ES | | Eversource Energy | | -23.10% | | -0.09% | | No. 485 | | CAG | | Conagra Brands | | -23.00% | | -0.06% Stocks that lost the most this year have a better-than-average chance of rebounding at the start of 2024. Value hunters should check the value factor grade first. Without fundamental catalysts, however, the rebound may prove short lived. Here are the ratings on a selection of the [worst-performing S&P 500 stocks](https://seekingalpha.com/comparison/new/MCUyQ3NlZGclMkNwZmUlMkNtcm5hJTJDZGclMkNhbGI=?compare=SEDG,PFE,MRNA,DG,ALB): Pfizer, Moderna, and Dollar General ( [DG](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/DG)) have varyingly strong quant factor grades, as shown above. Albemarle scores well on profitability and growth. However, Albemarle ( [ALB](https://seekingalpha.com/symbol/ALB)) stock has a √¢‚Ç¨≈ìSell√¢‚Ç¨ÔøΩ rating. Investors need to [watch EV demand and pricing closely](https://seekingalpha.com/news/4040563-albemarle-other-lithium-names-extend-losses-on-weak-pricing-as-ev-demand-cools). In addition, analysts forecast a brutal 30% drop in [Lithium carbon prices in China](https://www.reuters.com/markets/commodities/china-lithium-price-poised-further-decline-2024-analysts-2023-12-01/). 3. Allocation Mattered The S&P 500√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s return this year is a reminder that allocation mattered. Technology companies accounted for nearly two thirds of the index√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s gains. Investors who did not buy tech stocks after they fell in 2022 likely underperformed the market this year. | | Rank | | Ticker | | Company | | Contribution | | No. 1 | | ( | | Microsoft | | 12.39% | | No. 2 | | ( | | Apple | | 11.64% | | No. 3 | | ( | | NVIDIA | | 10.66% | | No. 4 | | ( | | Amazon.com | | 7.76% | | No. 5 | | ( | | Meta Platforms | | 6.55% | | No. 6 | | ( | | Tesla | | 4.72% | | No. 7 | | GOOGL | | Alphabet | | 3.80% | | No. 8 | | GOOG | | Alphabet | | 3.27% | | No. 9 | | ( | | Broadcom | | 2.88% | | No. 10 | | LLY | | Eli Lilly | | 2.13% Looking ahead, if sentiment reverses for tech, investors may want to rotate out of the sector. Still, if companies keep investing heavily in AI solutions, the winners above will keep running higher. Your Takeaway Investors who expected the bear market of 2022 to continue in 2023 missed out on the rebound. The fear of missing out (or FOMO) will run stronger as markets enter 2024. FOMO is one of the highest risks that investors face today. Hopes led to expectations of a rate cut. This is a primary driver of the positive sentiment. Markets are prone to mood change. This typically happens without warning. Investors cannot time markets but they can take some money off the table. While money markets still pay over 5%, the yield is falling as Treasury bond prices fall. In 2023, investors piled into cash [worth $1.3 trillion this year](https://seekingalpha.com/news/4050898-cash-was-indeed-king-in-2023-with-inflows-of-13-trillion). For 2024, they will need to decide how much to allocate into stocks and how much to lock in before interest rates start to fall. Please [+]Follow me for coverage on deeply-discounted stocks. Click on the "follow" button beside my name. author: CNN
title: Tulsi Gabbard declared her residency in Texas. Then she voted in Hawaii | Flipboard
text:
Tulsi Gabbard declared her residency in Texas. Then she voted in Hawaii CNN ‚Äî As Tulsi Gabbard completed her transformation from a Hawaii Democratic politician to a MAGA surrogate last year, she put down stakes in a far redder state. Gabbard and her husband bought a home outside of Austin and declared under oath last June that they were ‚Äúresident(s) of the State of ‚Ä¶

author: Adri√°n Jim√©nez
title: Activan alertas de vigilancia por posible formaci√≥n de un cicl√≥n tropical en el Caribe
text: Intensas [lluvias ](https://www.bluradio.com/meridiano-blu/emergencias-por-lluvias-en-antioquia-31-octubre-de-2024-meridiano-blu-programa-completo-pr30) que podr√≠an estar acompa√±adas de tormentas el√©ctricas son las que prev√© el Instituto de Hidrolog√≠a, Meteorolog√≠a y Estudios Ambientales, Ideam, para el archipi√©lago de San Andr√©s y La Guajira, todo por cuenta del tr√°nsito de una nueva perturbaci√≥n tropical en el suroccidente del mar Caribe que, seg√∫n la entidad, registra un 30% de probabilidad de desarrollo cicl√≥nico para las pr√≥ximas 48 horas. En el marco del protocolo de monitoreo y vigilancia que se implement√≥ en la regi√≥n Caribe por los efectos indirectos que podr√≠a traer consigo el fen√≥meno, el Ideam activ√≥ alerta de vigilancia para San Andr√©s y [La Guajira ](https://www.bluradio.com/regiones/caribe/nuevo-intento-de-gestion-del-riesgo-por-poner-a-funcionar-los-carrotanques-de-la-guajira-rg10), mientras que para los dem√°s departamentos de Caribe, sin incluir al Cesar, se encuentran bajo estado de aviso. David Garz√≥n, meteor√≥logo del Ideam, explic√≥ que estas lluvias tambi√©n podr√≠an generar vientos de hasta 20 nudos y alturas en el oleaje que llegar√≠an a los 1.5 metros. Publicidad "Por el momento, la zona en estudio se encuentra cerca de la regi√≥n Caribe colombiana, espec√≠ficamente en el suroccidente del mar Caribe, que ha dejado precipitaciones durante las √∫ltimas horas en el archipi√©lago de San Andr√©s y La Guajira". Asimismo, detall√≥ que "tambi√©n se han generado lluvias en las costas de C√≥rdoba, Sucre, Bol√≠var, Atl√°ntico y Magdalna, previ√©ndose que estas precipitaciones se intensifiquen hacia el d√≠a de ma√±ana, 02 de noviembre de 2024". Publicidad No obstante, el Ideam explic√≥ que, de llegarse a formar un [cicl√≥n ](https://www.bluradio.com/regiones/caribe/ideam-descarto-actividad-ciclonica-a-lo-largo-de-este-fin-de-semana-sobre-el-mar-caribe-rg10) tropical, teniendo en cuenta que para los pr√≥ximos siete d√≠as registra una probabilidad de hasta el 70%, ya se encontrar√≠a lejos del territorio colombiano, lo que bajar√≠a el nivel de riesgo para la isla San Andr√©s y La Guajira. A esto se suma que sobre el mar Caribe hay presencia de otras dos perturbaciones tropicales, teniendo en cuenta que una depresi√≥n tropical se encuentra cerca de Puerto Rico, lo que est√° generando abundante nubosidad y fuertes precipitaciones en Rep√∫blica Dominicana, las Islas V√≠rgenes, las Islas de Sotavento del norte y las aguas adyacentes del Atl√°ntico y el Caribe noreste. Por su parte, un √°rea de baja presi√≥n no tropical con fuerza de tormenta localizada al oeste de los Azores occidentales est√° produciendo aguaceros, previ√©ndose alg√∫n tipo de desarrollo subtropical mientras la baja se mueve hacia el este del [mar Caribe ](https://www.bluradio.com/regiones/caribe/declaran-alerta-amarilla-en-el-suroeste-del-mar-caribe-ante-pronosticos-de-fuertes-lluvias-rg10) durante los pr√≥ximos siete d√≠as.

author: (Foto: Matt Mills McKnight/Reuters)
title: Trabajadores de Boeing de EU se van huelga y detienen fabricaci√≥n de aviones
text:
Los trabajadores de la f√°brica de Boeing en la costa oeste de Estados Unidos abandonaron sus puestos de trabajo a primera hora del viernes tras rechazar por abrumadora mayor√≠a un acuerdo contractual, lo que detiene la producci√≥n del avi√≥n m√°s vendido de la compa√±√≠a, que se enfrenta a graves retrasos y una gran deuda.
La primera huelga desde 2008 ocurre en un momento en que el fabricante de aviones est√° sometido a un fuerte escrutinio por parte de los reguladores estadounidenses y los clientes tras el estallido del panel de una puerta en pleno vuelo en un 737 MAX en enero.
Publicidad La crisis ha afectado a las acciones de Boeing y ha provocado una agitaci√≥n en su c√∫pula directiva. Las acciones acumulan una p√©rdida cercana al 38%, con una p√©rdida de valor de mercado de 58,000 millones de d√≥lares.
El nuevo presidente ejecutivo, Kelly Ortberg, fue contratado hace apenas unas semanas para restaurar la fe en la compa√±√≠ay propuso un acuerdo que inclu√≠a un aumento salarial del 25% en cuatro a√±os, mucho menos que el 40% que piden los empleados.
Alrededor de 30,000 miembros de la Asociaci√≥n Internacional de Maquinistas y Trabajadores Aeroespaciales (IAM, por sus siglas en ingl√©s) que fabrican el 737 MAX, el avi√≥n m√°s vendido de Boeing, y otros reactores en las zonas de Seattle y Portland votaron sobre su primer contrato completo en 16 a√±os, con 94.6% de rechazo y 96% a favor de la huelga en una votaci√≥n en dos partes.
"Se trata de respeto, se trata de abordar el pasado y se trata de luchar por nuestro futuro", dijo Jon Holden, que dirigi√≥ las negociaciones del mayor sindicato de Boeing, antes de anunciar el resultado de la votaci√≥n el jueves por la noche.
Holden dijo a los medios que el sindicato volver√° a la mesa lo antes posible, sin precisar cu√°nto tiempo cree que durar√° la huelga ni cu√°ndo se reanudar√°n las conversaciones. Boeing afirm√≥ en un comunicado que est√° dispuesto a volver a la mesa de negociaciones, una se√±al de que podr√≠a mejorar su propuesta.
"El mensaje fue claro: el acuerdo provisional que alcanzamos con los dirigentes de IAM no es aceptable para los miembros. Seguimos comprometidos con restablecer nuestra relaci√≥n con nuestros empleados y el sindicato, y estamos dispuestos a volver a la mesa para llegar a un nuevo acuerdo", dijo el fabricante de aviones en un comunicado.
Una huelga larga podr√≠a afectar gravemente a las finanzas de Boeing, que ya se tambalean debido a una deuda de 60,000 millones de d√≥lares.
El acuerdo propuesto inclu√≠a una prima de firma de 3,000 d√≥lares y el compromiso de construir el pr√≥ximo avi√≥n comercial de Boeing en la zona de Seattle, siempre que el programa se pusiera en marcha dentro del plazo del contrato.
"La pregunta clave ahora es la duraci√≥n de la huelga dada la brecha entre el aumento salarial propuesto y la solicitud de los miembros del sindicato", dijo en una nota Chloe Lemarie, analista de Jefferies, agregando que una huelga larga plantea un riesgo clave para la producci√≥n del 737 MAX.
Si bien la direcci√≥n de la IAM recomend√≥ el pasado domingo a sus miembros que aceptaran el contrato, muchos trabajadores respondieron de forma airada, defendiendo la demandaoriginal y lamentando la p√©rdida de una prima anual.
Los trabajadores han estado protestando toda la semana en las f√°bricas de Boeing de la zona de Seattle que ensamblan los aviones MAX, 777 y 767.
Los miembros del sindicato vitoreaban y coreaban "¬°Huelga! ¬°Huelga! Huelga!", y poco despu√©s de medianoche empezaron a reunirse frente a las entradas de las f√°bricas de Boeing en la zona de Seattle. Muchos agitaban pancartas en las que se le√≠a: "En huelga contra Boeing" y los conductores que pasaban tocaban el claxon de sus veh√≠culos en se√±al de apoyo.
El Gobierno del presidente Joe Biden est√° en contacto con ambas partes, dijo el jueves la secretaria de prensa de la Casa Blanca, Karine Jean Pierre. "Vamos a animar a ambas partes a negociar de esa manera, de buena fe y alcanzando un contrato fuerte", se√±al√≥.

author: @footballespana_
title: Pedri reveals training changes that have helped solve injury issues
text:
Barcelona have had an excellent season up until now, and at the heart of everything in recent months has been midfield maestro Pedri. The 22-year-old has been a sensation for Hansi Flick‚Äôs side, and those within Can Barca will hope that he continues to be a crucial player for the remaining weeks of the current campaign.
With just over two months to go until the season‚Äôs end, Barcelona are well-placed for success in three competitions: La Liga, the Champions League and the Copa del Rey. And as he told RAC1 (via Marca ), Pedri is aiming to help the Catalans win all three titles.
‚ÄúWe are alive in the three titles, we are young, so why not dream big? I would be very excited about the Champions League, I have never won it and it has been a long time since Barcelona won it. Against Borussia Dortmund it will be a tough game, but I have a lot of confidence in the team.‚Äù
Image via Goal / Getty Pedri has been ever-present for Barcelona this season, and he has firmly put his previous injury problems behind him. He opened up on the process behind this.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve worked hard to be in good shape. I haven‚Äôt changed anything about eating. The way of training, yes. Now I don‚Äôt lift a weight, I do stretches and work more with rubber bands. Personally, it suits me better and is one of the ways I have found to feel good. Physically the body also evolves over the years.
‚ÄúI am very confident that the injury problems are over. I see them as a thing of the past. I notice that playing regularly helps me. When I stop for a week or there are more days between games, I feel more tired. My body is like that. I think I‚Äôm in one of the best moments of my career. The first season was also very good. It was a year that marked me a lot and it was spectacular.‚Äù

author: Paul Vallely
title: Paul Vallely: UK‚Äôs double standards in Middle East
text:
Friday 02 February 2024
Why was it so quick to cut aid to the UNRWA, asks Paul Vallely
A UNRWA lorry at the Rafah border crossing
IT‚ÄôS HARD to work out the real policy of the British Government towards Israel and Gaza. It is now talking about accelerating our formal recognition of a Palestinian state. Only days before, it was cutting off funding to the UN agency that facilitates the paltry supply of aid which trickles through to Gaza. One minute, it is calling for military de-escalation in the region, the next, it is bombing the Palestinians‚Äô Houthi allies, widening the crisis in this Middle Eastern tinderbox.
Over the weekend, the UK suspended funding to the United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA), whose 13,000 Gazan staff deliver food aid, medicine, and education to almost two million Palestinians who have been displaced from their homes by Israeli bombing. The move came after Israel provided the United States with a dossier alleging that 12 UNRWA members of staff were involved in the 7 October terrorist attacks.
The UNRWA swiftly fired nine men (two are dead and the other is missing) and launched an investigation. But that was not enough to stop the UK from withholding funding. This was an extraordinarily precipitate response. Israel has not made public its evidence. The dossier is just six pages long. It was passed to Washington on the very day that the International Court of Justice ordered Israel to take action to prevent genocide by its forces in Gaza and to allow more aid into the territory.
Amnesty and Christian Aid condemned the withdrawal of aid as ‚Äúcruel‚Äù and a ‚Äúcollective punishment‚Äù. Penalising a million refugees for the crimes of 12 individuals, said Chris Gunness, the UNRWA‚Äôs former director of communications, was ‚Äúlike cutting funding to the NHS because of the actions of Lucy Letby‚Äù.
In response, Israel leaked to The New York Times that ‚Äúnearly 200 UNRWA workers are Hamas or Islamic Jihad operatives‚Äù. It then told The Wall Street Journal that the figure was nearer 1200. Again, Israel provided no evidence.
It is hard not to detect in all this a co-ordinated political and economic attack on the UNRWA, the body that distributes food and provides temporary shelter in its schools, in Gaza. Since 1949, it has been charged with the care of 5.9 million Palestinians displaced from their homes ‚Äî in Gaza, the West Bank, Jordan, Lebanon, and Syria ‚Äî by the foundation of the State of Israel.
Hardline Israelis have long seen the UNRWA as an obstacle to resolving the Palestinian problem. They argue that its very existence prevents refugees from integrating into their host communities. It fuels Palestinian dreams of one day returning to Israel, in such numbers that they would change the country‚Äôs Jewish character.
Recent claims that the UNRWA is a front for Hamas should be seen against the backdrop of decades of hostility. ‚ÄúWe cannot win this war without dismantling UNRWA,‚Äù said a former Israel foreign ministry official, Noga Arbell, recently. Since October, Israel has killed 152 UNRWA workers and destroyed 141 of its compounds.
The UK‚Äôs double standards, in the light of all this, are perplexing. Action against the body assisting so many innocent civilians is swift ‚Äî although the evidence, such as it is, is massively disproportionate. Meanwhile, uncritical support for the government inflicting this devastation continues unabated. Our moral compass is in need of serious reorientation.

author: @techandco
title: Tanks et lance-flammes: la star am√©ricaine des armes √† feu annonce la fin de sa cha√Æne Youtube
text:
Demolition Ranch, un youtubeur sp√©cialiste des armes √† feu suivi par 11,8 millions d'abonn√©s, a d√©cid√© de mettre fin √† sa cha√Æne Youtube. Il met √©galement en vente sa propri√©t√©, estim√©e √† 15 millions de dollars. C'est la fin d'une aventure qui aura dur√© plus de 14 ans. Matt Carriker, plus connu sous le nom de Demolition Ranch, a annonc√© ce mardi 28 janvier mettre fin √† sa carri√®re.
"Je vais prendre ma retraite et je vais vendre la propri√©t√© du complexe [le lieu o√π il filmait son contenu , ndlr ]", a sobrement annonc√© dans une vid√©o le youtubeur sp√©cialis√© dans les armes √† feu , suivi par 11,8 millions d'abonn√©s. "J'ai d√©pass√© tous mes objectifs" L'influenceur va donc fermer sa cha√Æne et vendre sa propri√©t√© o√π il tournait ses contenus. Le ranch de plus de 2.000 m2 est affich√© au prix de 15 millions de dollars.
"J'ai ador√© √ßa, mais j'ai d√©pass√© tous les objectifs que je m'√©tais fix√©s. Ma femme et moi avons r√©alis√© r√©cemment que nous avions r√©ussi et que nos enfants vieillissaient tr√®s vite et qu'ils ne resteraient pas tr√®s longtemps √† la maison. Cela nous a vraiment touch√©s", poursuit le v√©t√©rinaire texan de 38 ans.
Bien que le youtubeur admette √™tre "nerveux et triste" √† l'id√©e de laisser sa cha√Æne et sa communaut√© derri√®re lui, il est surtout enthousiaste d'embrasser une nouvelle vie et de pouvoir profiter de sa famille. "Je sais que je ne regarderai pas en arri√®re et ne dirai pas: 'J'aurais aim√© faire plus de vid√©os sur Youtube'", assure-t-il.
Tirer sur un camion avec un char d'assaut Le cr√©ateur de contenus a lanc√© sa cha√Æne en janvier 2011, lorsqu'il n'√©tait encore qu'un √©tudiant. Au cours de sa carri√®re, l'influenceur a partag√© plus de 700 vid√©os sur le th√®me des armes. Dans ses vid√©os, on peut ainsi le voir tester toutes sortes d'armes √† feu, dans des mises en sc√®ne spectaculaires. Il tente ainsi de tirer sur un camion avec un char d'assaut ou teste la r√©sistance des casques de l'arm√©e aux balles.
En plus de son contenu sur les armes √† feu , Demolition Ranch vend en ligne des produits d√©riv√©s portant le nom de la cha√Æne. Au programme, des t-shirts, des sweat-shirts, des casquettes ou encore des glaci√®res et des autocollants. Un de ses t-shirts a notamment √©t√© achet√© et port√© par Thomas Matthew Crooks lors de sa tentative d'assassinat de Donald Trump , en juillet dernier.
Sans surprise, son annonce a vite fait r√©agir sa communaut√©. "J'en pleure presque. Je regarde tes vid√©os depuis que j'ai 12 ans. J'en ai 25 maintenant", souligne un internaute. "√áa me brise le c≈ìur", ajoute un autre. "C'est comme si la copine avec laquelle je pensais me marier me disait qu'elle d√©m√©nageait et qu'elle ne voulait pas que je l'accompagne."
Mais que les fans de l'Am√©ricain se rassurent: l'aventure Youtube n'est pas encore termin√©e. Demolition Ranch pr√©voit de continuer ses vid√©os encore deux mois afin de pouvoir honorer les contrats de marque qu'il a d√©j√† accept√©.
Salom√© Ferraris

author: Trina Dennis Brittain tbrittain@rocketminer.com
title: Mayor Mickelson discusses Rock Springs' culture in State of the City Address
text:
ROCK SPRINGS ‚Äì Key topics during this year's State of the City Address included caring for one another as neighbors, collaborating with other entities, local progress and mental health struggles within the community.
Mickelson spoke to constituents at Santa Fe Southwest Grill on Thursday, March 14.
True grit
Mickelson shared the story of two brothers, Archibald and Duncan Blair; they opened a coal mine in 1868 on a windswept, hardscrabble chunk of the Wyoming Territory.
‚ÄúNobody lost their mind. They didn't lose their drive or their grit,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúTheir descendants, the Hay Family, opened Rock Springs National Bank in 1892, four years after Rock Springs became incorporated as a city.‚Äù
The bank will be celebrating their 132nd anniversary on June 10 and is still run by the same family.
‚ÄúThe demand for coal by the Union Pacific Railroad fed our community's growth,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúWe were the company town known as the home of 56 nationalities. Their practice back then was to bring in folks from countries all over the world, from lots of different cultures, because it helped keep people separate. It was their effort to prevent unionization and life was good and everyone had their own little community within the greater community of our city.‚Äù
He noted that when mine employees worked, they worked for their very life culture, ‚Äúwhere taking care of each is the norm.‚Äù
‚ÄúIn our city, that culture has survived into the 21st century. We know how to pull together both in good times and in bad,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat dependency creates a special culture. As good as the early days were during the Great Depression, things weren't so good. By 1933, one quarter of our town relied on soup kitchens for meals, a parallel to today where 46% of our K-12 students are on the free or reduced lunch.‚Äù
He pointed out that while Union Pacific provided some assistance, the real heroes were people like the Hay Family. They had seen how our city and its people were suffering when folks couldn't pay their notes, but instead of punishing them for it, they worked with them to come up with better solutions.
Partnerships
According to Mickelson, the city of Rock Springs has very strong relationships with their partners, working continuously and collaboratively with local, state and federal partners. The Bureau of Land Management (BLM) allowed the city to put in a detention pond to reduce flooding on the Northeast side of town.
From the Sweetwater County Commissioners to the Wyoming Legislature, Gov. Gordon‚Äôs office and state agencies, he said that the relationships have been ‚Äúfruitful and positive.‚Äù They also continue to grow their relationship with the Sweetwater Economic Development Coalition, the Sweetwater Events Complex, Rock Springs Main Street/Urban Renewal Agency, Sweetwater Travel and Tourism, SCSD1, Western Wyoming Community College, Memorial Hospital of Sweetwater County, Aspen Medical Center and many others.
Mickelson took a moment to acknowledge the work that the district and legislative members did in accomplishing the funding for the new high school in Rock Springs.
‚ÄúWe are working closely with our business partners, both old and new, to ensure that the prosperity of our city continues.‚Äù
He admitted that communication with all constituents can be challenging to accomplish, but the city of Rock Springs is finding ways to make it easier, assuring them the city wants to hear from them and that ‚Äúit is safe to share their concerns.‚Äù
‚ÄúReaching those who are disengaged from government has been difficult,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúNevertheless, we have persisted; we see the value of having an ongoing conversation with the citizens of our city.‚Äù
Mickelson and city officials have been speaking on radio shows, providing updates around issues facing the community and celebrate the successes.
‚ÄúNevertheless, our challenges haven't vanished. We still have buildings that need upkeep, roads that need improved or maintained to the industry needs, equipment aging out of usefulness, and a massive affordable housing gap,‚Äù he said, mentioning that we can ‚Äòknock on wood‚Äô and hope for the best. ‚ÄúThe reality is, though, things are looking really good for Rock Springs.
‚ÄúWe are looking at how we can position our city to be as strong as it can going forward.‚Äù
He said that sales and use taxes are strong. They are ahead of their budget projection and ‚Äúthe forecast is excellent.‚Äù It is tempting, however, to use those funds to add amenities, but the city‚Äôs leader cautions against this.
‚ÄúDespite being a wild old hippie, author Kurt Vonnegut was not wrong when he said. ‚ÄúFlaw in the human character is that everyone wants to build, and nobody wants to do maintenance.‚Äù
He encourages the community to focus on what would the most cost-effective use of tax dollars would be in delivering ‚Äúthe highest quality of service.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe must align our city to meet the needs of industrial growth while we diversify that same industrial and business space to move beyond our boom and bust cycle. We must engender an environment where housing development is attractive enough to developers to shrink our affordable housing gap for this coming fiscal year.‚Äù
The city of Rock Springs is currently working on a comprehensive and stakeholder driven strategic plan for the parks and recreation system.
‚ÄúWe will decide as a community where our focus should be and how to best meet the needs of our city.‚Äù
The city of Rock Springs will distribute surveys to see how they align with our city‚Äôs residents‚Äô priorities. He said that surveys will be sent during the next budget cycle for the mayor and city council to make fully informed decisions. He also plans to distribute short monthly update videos to keep citizens informed about the city government's activities. They are also working to select consultants who specialize in reviewing municipal code.
‚ÄúThe intent is to have them evaluate our ordinances to see what we need.‚Äù
Mental Health Crisis
Mickelson expressed that the one thing that is very near to his heart is the mental health crisis of our community.
‚ÄúAnd make no mistake, there is a crisis.‚Äù
‚ÄúIf we do not find the will to address this, our other efforts and successes will always be diminished,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúOur suicide rate is appalling, heartbreaking and unacceptable. We are losing so many people.‚Äù
To address this, city officials are working on assembling a task force to develop actionable steps to provide resources to those who are struggling.
‚ÄúAmid our current prosperity and growth, we cannot fully celebrate until we address this openly, concretely and productively. We will need to rely on each other here as strongly as we have in facing our past challenges, and we must fully embrace the mining culture that brought people from 56 different nations and cultures together as one community to tackle this critical issue.‚Äù
Preparing for growth
‚ÄúI believe all of us are ready to take that courageous first step of embracing the adventure of change, knowing we are a community that takes care of each other and stands together,‚Äù Mickelson said, noting that a big boom is heading to the Southwest region and that the public shouldn‚Äôt let persistent negativity on social media get them down.
‚ÄúWe live in an incredibly, increasingly prosperous community filled with good people who have maintained their culture of mutual support. We are truly blessed beyond measure. There will always be those who take pleasure in tearing down the good around them.‚Äù
He pointed out that Rock Springs hasn‚Äôt always had the best reputation because ‚Äúwe let those loud few tell our story.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe, the majority, can and must use our voices to tell the true story of our city.‚Äù
He said, ‚ÄúOur community reminds me of this. Two are better than one because they have a good return for their labor. If either of them falls down, one can help the other up. As we move forward, we must preserve our sense of community by supporting our local businesses, participating in our community events, and most importantly, looking out for our neighbors.
‚ÄúTogether, we will continue to build on our history for a prosperous and bright tomorrow.‚Äù
